Rosa had always looked forward to her job as a French teacher. It was stimulating and having completed further training courses, she felt more than qualified for the job. It was the first time she had beenin control of a group of people and it was working out! She knew this because that morning a student had been having problems with a language point, which she had explained patiently and clearly. The student was delighted to comprehend the point, and the rest of the class had continued working while Rosa sat with the student. Some classes would have been disruptive she contemplated.
I ’ll have been at this school three years soon, she thought to herself … I ’ve been thinking about another job; perhaps a more senior position. Perhaps, I should have applied for that advisory position in the school in Italy …
When she got home that night, there was a message on the answer phone. An old colleague had contacted her to see if she wanted to work in Spain …
